page.title: 15Llangyfelach Church
page.content:
The Parish{Church}of St. Cyfelach, {Llangyfelach.
Ynystawe is in the parish of Llangyfelach. We went to visit the church in our school minibus. We went along the M4{motorway.}It took us six minutes. Many years ago a {fair}was held there and stalls put on the grave stones. It would have taken two hours to walk there from Ynystawe. The school log book for March 1879 says children had a day off to go to the fair.
At Llangyfelach Church the tower is not part of the church. The old church collapsed and a new one was built from a nearby barn. Behind the tower is a Celtic Cross. It is from the tenth century. Some of the grave-stones are carved in Welsh and some in English.
